message.content:
cs.CL, cs.SI, cs.SD, cs.CY, cs.CR 

This paper deals with the problem of detecting abusive language in online conversations, which is a common topic in the field of computational linguistics (cs.CL). The paper also proposes fusion methods that integrate content- and graph-based features, which involves analyzing the structure of conversations, making it relevant to social network analysis (cs.SI) and social network dynamics (cs.SD). Additionally, the paper deals with the problem of moderation in online communities, which could fall under the category of cybersecurity (cs.CR) or cyberpsychology (cs.CY).
